title: Sip into the Holidays with an Easy Iced Gingerbread Chai Latte
promptIMG: Food photography: Iced Gingerbread Chai Latte, appetizing presentation, natural lighting, kitchen setting, documentary style, realistic colors --ar 4:3 --quality 2
description: This iced gingerbread chai latte is the perfect festive drink. With creamy oat milk and warm spices, it's a cozy treat for chilly days. Great for holiday gatherings!
instructions: Brew the chai tea bag in a cup of hot water for about 3 minutes.
Remove the tea bag and let it cool slightly.
In a glass, add ice cubes to your liking.
Pour the brewed chai over the ice, then add the oat milk.
Stir in the gingerbread syrup until well combined.
Top with whipped cream if desired and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
tips: A key tip for this drink is to brew the chai strong enough to hold its flavor against the oat milk. If you don’t have gingerbread syrup, you can use molasses or maple syrup for sweetness. This drink is best enjoyed fresh, but you can mix the chai and oat milk in advance and add ice later!

structured_content.content: Every holiday season, I find myself craving cozy drinks that bring warmth and comfort. This iced gingerbread chai latte is my go-to, combining the spiced warmth of chai with the festive flavors of gingerbread. It’s super easy to whip up and makes for a delightful treat during chilly evenings or holiday gatherings.

For this latte, you'll need oat milk, which adds a creamy texture without overpowering the spices. The gingerbread syrup is what really makes this drink special, giving it that sweet, holiday essence. If you're out of oat milk, almond milk works just as well!

This recipe comes together in just a few minutes. Brew your chai tea strong, mix it with oat milk and gingerbread syrup, and you’ve got a delicious drink ready to enjoy. The key is to balance the flavors, so feel free to adjust the syrup to your taste!
